bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to James D. Porter, April 19, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: To the Asst. Secy of State.

Receipt of schedule stating appropriations for diplomatic and Consular service for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1888. Stationary for the Consulor agent at Cape Coast Castle has been forwarded by Despatch Agency at Loubou.
Hon. Jas D. Porter Asst Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform you that the schedule or circular stating appropriations for diplomatic and Consular service by the government of the United States for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1888 has been received. Stationary for the Consulor Agency at Cape Coast Castle has been forwarded
forwarded b your despatch Agency at London.
I have the honor to be Sir your obedient Servant
Samuel S. Sevier U.S> Vice Consul Genl
Hon. J. D. Porter Asst Secry of State Washington D.C.
